article_title: DOJ Antitrust Chief Airs Doubts On Health Insurer Tie-Ups
article_text:
DOJ Antitrust Chief Airs Doubts On Health Insurer Tie-Ups

Law360, New York (November 13, 2015, 6:57 PM ET) -- The U.S. Department of Justice’s top antitrust enforcer on Friday voiced skepticism about the benefits of consolidation in the health insurance industry, a potential red flag for proposed megamergers among leading insurers.



Assistant Attorney General Bill Baer, head of the DOJ’s Antitrust Division, made the comments at a Yale Law School conference on competition in the health care industry, according to prepared remarks released by the department. Although Baer did not mention specific companies, his words seemed relevant to a pair of pending megamergers — one...
